intro: Agapetes hosseana, commonly known as the silverleaf agapete, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is native to the Andean region of South America, particularly in Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, evergreen leaves that are densely covered with silvery-white hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, which bloom in late spring or early summer. Agapetes hosseana is often found growing in moist, shaded environments such as cloud forests and mountainous regions.
